title: Ticket #5123: Malformed concurrency limits break condor_userprio
description:
The accountant expects concurrency limit names to follow certain restrictions (composed of letters, digits, underscores, and at most one dot), but nothing enforces that. The accountant's internal record keeping is fine if names contain other characters, but it will attempt to construct invalid ClassAd attribute names when sending user priority data to condor_userprio or condor_q -analyze. The tools fail as a result.

Condor_submit and the negotiator should reject and/or ignore concurrency limits that don't follow the pattern described above.
